text:
Park Row, east side, south from and including Spruce Street, to and including Broadway. Also shown is Nassau Street, east side, south from and including Spruce, to and including Fulton Streets. The view shows the New York Times Building, at the intersection of Park Row, and Nassau Street, and the rear of the General Post Office on Mail Street. In the foreground is seen a portion of City Hall Park, while in the background, and at the termination of Park Row, is seen St. Paul's Protestant Episcopal Chapel.

About 1870.

Brown Brothers.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

text:
Park Row, north from Spruce Street and showing prominently the Municipal Building (Centre Street and Park Row) under construction. On the left is City Hall Park; a rear view of the 5-story City Court and the new Hall of Records. The enclosed bridge structure provided access to the Brooklyn Bridge and its transportation facilities.

About 1910

Ewing Galloway
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

text:
Park Row, north from and including Spruce Street. The view shows (from left to right), the N. Y. City Hall, Hall of Records, the Municipal Building, the N. Y. Herold Building, the Pulitzer (World) Building, Tribune Building and the Potter (Times) Building. Bridge shown in the foreground, across Park Row, is an extension from the Brooklyn Bridge Station of the Second and Third Aves., Elevated Lines.

About 1927.

New York Edison Co.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

text:
Park Row, east side, south from and including Spruce Street, to but not including Broadway. Also shown is Nassau Street, west side, south from and including Spruce Street. The view is taken from the Municipal Building, and shows a portion of City Hall Park in the foreground.

June 23, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street

text:
Park Row, east side, at Spruce Street, as seen across City Hall Park. The view shows a portion of the General Post Office on the right.

June 24, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

All buildings in view, except P.O., still extant - 1966!
title: Manhattan: Park Row - Spruce Street
